# How the 48 States Voted In Presidential Balloting
## 
### 
Elcc. votes Dewey Truman Wallace Thurmond °/c
11 Alabama 20.000 0 1,000 104.000 48
4 Arizona 16,000 22.000 34
9 Arkansas 15,000 52,000 18.000 38
25 California G04.762 603.003 57.000 62
6 Colorado 70,255 80,534 1,655 65
8 Connecticut 438,000 422,000 13,000 100
3 Delaware 38.000 39,000 84
8 Florida 147.000 194.000 10.000 60,000 59
12 Georgia 50.000 166.000 1.500 64,000 38
4 Idaho 74,000 77,000 3,000 40
28 Illinois 1,173.000 1,274,000
14 Indiana 422.000 437,000 46
10 lowa 204,000 230,000 5,000 46
8 Kansas 80,000 60,000 29
11 Kentucky 248,000 348,000 1,000 7,000 69
10 Louisiana 35,000 30,000 2.000 74.000 25
5 Maine 136.000 101,000 1,700 89
8 Maryland 278.000 270,000 2,000 9,000 95
16 Massachusetts 361.000 477,000 14.000 47
19 Michigan 284,000 228,000 6.000 27
11 Minnesota 755,000 226,000 8,000 19
9 Mississippi 2,000 9,000 85,000 47
15 Missouri 417,000 598,000 7,500 74
4 Montana 28,000 38.000 1,800 29
6 Nebraska 105.000 82,0000 47
3 Nevada 24,055 23,955 9,095 90
4 New Hampshire 92,000 75.000 90
16 New Jersey 888,000 833,000 39,000 87
4 New Mexico 19,000 29,000 55
47 New York 2.833.000 2.792,000 500.000 99
14 No. Carolina 206.000 381,000 3,000 57,000 81
4 No. Dakota 29,000 26,000 1,500 21
25 Ohio 1,000,500 1,003,200 13,700 72
10 Oklahoma 229,000 407,000 92
6 Oregon 63,499 46,176 2,942 45
35 Pennsylvania 1,853,000 1,703,000 52,000 97
4 Rhode Island 134,000 188,000 2,500 100
8 So. Carolina 5,000 30,000 89,000 75
4 So. Dakota 57,000 54,000 1,000 44
12 Tennessee 155,000 215,000 1,000 59,000 92
23 Texas 162,000 422,000 2,000 55,000 88
4 Utah 78,000 91,000 1,200 32
3 Vermont 76,000 45,000 1,200 100
11 Virginia 160,000 187,000 92
8 Washington 71,000 84,000 5,000 20
8 West Virginia 201,000 284,000 1,400 59
12 Wisconsin 479,000 533,000 19,000 81
3 Wyoming 31,000 . 33,000 76
531 TOTALS 14,621,000 15,418,000 802,000 734.000 67
State-by-state voting statistics for President include results up to
2:15 a.m. (PI>T).
President Truman leads in 28 states, having 292 electoral votes.
Thomas E. Dewey leads in 16 states, having 201 electoral votes.
Elcc. votes Dewey Truman Wallace Thurmond °/c

2:15 a.m. (PI>T).
President Truman leads in 28 states, having 292 electoral votes.
Thomas E. Dewey leads in 16 states, having 201 electoral votes.

2:15 a.m. (PI>T).

Thomas E. Dewey leads in 16 states, having 201 electoral votes.

2:15 a.m. (PI>T).

Thomas E. Dewey leads in 16 states, having 201 electoral votes.

531 TOTALS 14,621,000 15,418,000 802,000 734.000 67
State-by-state voting statistics for President include results up to
2:15 a.m. (PI>T).
President Truman leads in 28 states, having 292 electoral votes.
Thomas E. Dewey leads in 16 states, having 201 electoral votes.
Elcc. votes Dewey Truman Wallace Thurmond °/c
11 Alabama 20.000 0 1,000 104.000 48
4 Arizona 16,000 22.000 34
9 Arkansas 15,000 52,000 18.000 38
25 California G04.762 603.003 57.000 62
6 Colorado 70,255 80,534 1,655 65
8 Connecticut 438,000 422,000 13,000 100
3 Delaware 38.000 39,000 84
8 Florida 147.000 194.000 10.000 60,000 59
12 Georgia 50.000 166.000 1.500 64,000 38

2:15 a.m. (PI>T).
